greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Sum of the divisors of the primorial inflation of n.
link: Index entries for sequences related to primorial numbers
Index entries for sequences related to sigma(n)
mathematica: Array[DivisorSigma[1, Apply[Times, FactorInteger[#] /. {p_, e_} /; e > 0 :> Apply[Times, Prime@ Range@ PrimePi@ p]^e]] &, 46] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Aug 27 2020 *)
program: (PARI) A337203(n) = if(1==n,n, my(f=factor(n), h = #f~, prevpid=primepi(f[h,1]), e=f[h,2], p, s=1); forstep(i=h-1,0,-1, if(!i,pid=0,pid=primepi(f[i,1])); forstep(j=prevpid,(1+pid),-1, p=prime(j); s *= ((p^(1+e)-1)/(p-1))); if(!pid,return(s)); prevpid = pid; e += f[i,2]); (s));
xref: Row 0 of A337205, and of A337472.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Aug 22 2020
